    • This page will be updated frequently with examples, video tutorials, links to new resources, and occasional updates to LAB ASSIGNMENTS. Our schedule follows the Current MHL Academic Calendar. The following topics and their precise order may change. Check here for updates!

    Week 1: 2 April

    Digital Filters Revisited

    Start-of-Semester Business

    • Review Syllabus + course policies.
    • Review Software Installation.

    Listening

    Tutorials

    • Basic Signal Diagram Components

    Downloads

    Assignments (always due before the next class!)

    • Install + Authorize MaxMSP
    • Install the CNMAT Externals package (Search for CNMAT Externals in Package Manager. See instructions for using the Max Package Manager on our Software + Resources page.)
    • Filter Characteristics (Digital Filter Basics)
    • Test Signals (Digital Filter Basics)

    Week 10: 4 June

    Plate Excited By A Strike Force

    Definitions

    • Chaos Theory
    • Strange Attractor
    • Thomas’ cyclically symmetric attractor
    • MIT Animation of the Thomas Attractor

    “the trajectory of a frictionally dampened particle moving in a 3D lattice of forces”

    “b corresponds to how dissipative the system is”

    “dt is the time step: larger values means the particles move faster”

    Tutorials

    • List of Strange Attractors + Fractals
    • Chaotic Sounds Video Tutorial

    Downloads

    • Chaotic boiler patches
